items module¶

This module contains the describe of items for snake game.

platform

Linux

author

Ovod18

class items.Food(snake_width, display_width, display_height, inf_height)¶

Bases: object

This class describes a food.

METHODS

Food.get_size()

Food.get_pos()

Food.get_color()

Food.set_size()

Food.set_pos()


ATTRIBUTES

size: int¶
The size of food.
dw: int¶
The display width.
dh: int¶
The display height.
inf height
The height of information line.
primary_x: int¶
The primary x coordinate of food.
primary_y: int¶
The primary y coordinate of food.
pos: list¶
The list of coordinates pos[x, y] of food.
color: tuple = 0, 255, 0¶
The color of food.

draw(scene)¶

This method renders the food

Parameters

scene (object) – The scene for rendering food (pygame.display).


get_color()¶

This method return current color of food.

Returns

color

Return type

tuple


get_pos()¶

This method return the coordinates of food.

Returns

pos

Return type

list


get_size()¶

This method return the size of food.

Returns

size

Return type

int


set_color()¶

This method sets color of food.


set_pos(snake_body, snake_width)¶

This method sets position of food.

Parameters

  • snake_width (int) – The width of snake.

  • snake_body (list) – The list of segment objects.


set_size(*args)¶

This method sets the size of food.

argsint

args contain the snake width, the food size. snake width: int food size : int, str The food size maybe int value in range(2) or ‘r’. If the food size is ‘r’ then self.__size will be random value in (sw // 3, sw // 2, sw), where sw is the snake width.

ATTRIBUTES

self.__x0: int¶
The initial X coordinate of playing ground.
self.__y0: int¶
The initial Y coordinate of playing ground.
self.__x: int¶
The final X coordinate of playing ground.
self.__y: int¶
The final Y coordinate of playing ground.
pos: tuple((int, int), (int, int))¶
The tuple, which contains initial and final coordinates of
playing ground.

This method returns the coordinates of playing ground.

Returns

the tuple, which contains initial and final coordinates.

tuple((int, int), (int, int))

class items.Snake(snake_width)¶

This class defines the snake.

ATTRIBUTES

width: int¶
The snake width.
body¶
The list of snake segments.

Segment()

pos_change: list[int, int] = 0, 0¶
The course (pixels) of snake movement.
course: str = 'empty'¶
The course (word) of snake movement.

draw(scene)¶

This method renders the snake body.

Parameters

scene (object) – The scene for rendering the body (pygame.display).

eat(food_size, food_color)¶

This method defines eating snake food.

Parameters

food_size (int) – The size of food.


get_body()¶

This method return the list of segments of snake.

Returns

the list of snake segments.

Return type

list[object,]


get_course()¶

This method return current course of snake movement.

Returns

The course of snake movement.

Return type

str

This method return current position of snake head.

Returns

The list of coordinates of the snake head.

Return type

move(play_ground)¶

This method defines snake movement.


set_course(course, speed)¶

This method sets the course of snake movement.

Parameters

  • course (str) – The course of snake movement.

  • speed (int) – The nubers of pixels of snake movement.


set_pos(pos)¶

This method sets position of snake head.

Parameters

pos (list) – pos[int, int] is list of coordinates.
